Name: Guenma√Ø
Reviews:
For the vegan traveller looking to take a walking break - what a gem!! This place has such heart, I absolutely adore it!! Flavours and quality of ingredients, with a fresh squeezed juice.. fantastic!! Definitely enjoying the light grocery shopping after. Probably taking home some granola :)
Thank you, thank you, thank you for this beautiful healthy place!! Home!

This was the first meal we had in Paris and it was okay. We started out with the miso soup which was more like a Korean miso soup rather than the traditional Japanese version, more flavorful and with vegetables added instead of just tofu. I can't remember the name of what we had for our main dishes, but it was a plate of dips and steamed vegetables with a salad. The white bean dip and the olive paste were the only outstanding items. The service was a bit slow, but it was the kitchen, not the server's. You pay at the register at the front where you deal with the non-English speaking lady which was fine since I got by on enough high school French.

We went there to eat in our way to Notre Damme. Althought it was a bit late for lunch in Paris (about 15 h) it was no problem.
It's true that the kitchen is a bit slow, but the service was express (but not much english speaking).
We went directly for the main course that was fine, a macrobiotic plate that I cannot recall its name. For dessert we took different sorts of apple cake (with nuts). As beverage we took an excellent carriot juice.
At about 45 ‚Ç¨ for 2 persons it was I bit pricey in my opinion.

Macrobiotic health food store and tea shop with a little cafe in the back. I am not sure if it was really vegan, as something tasted very like tempura fish. I know zero French, but they were still nice to me and I pointed at something I wanted on the pictureless menu. Got a macrobiotic plate with lentils, carrots and cabbage, couscous-like grain, and a bowl of what seemed like pumpkin tom kha - that was the best part. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I knew more about macrobiotic food; I was going in search of vegan fare since I have a dairy allergy. I also thought ‚Ç¨17.50 was a little pricey.

They are only open for lunch yet their Google listing claims they're open until 8:30pm. Very misleading. We traveled all the way to them based on their vegetarian menu but were disappointed when they told us no dinner was available at 7pm. Please update your Google maps listing to stop misleading first time visitors.

A rip-off. I ordered a friut juice and a cereal vegetable item the size of a ping- pong ball (2.75 euros). The lady asked if I wanted some crudites with it. What she did not say was that a few strips of carrot cucumber abd red beets would increase the price of my ping- pong ball by 500 percent!
I ended up having to pay 16 euros! Her comment? Oh , I forgot to show you the menu! I have seldom felt so cheated.

Such little gem! Food was delicious, location cannot be beat and this place is run by people who genuinely care about their customers. They also have a shop with amazing products. Will return for sure!!!
Excellent yummy healthy food. After a few days of indulging in all the Parisian food and wine, this felt like a great cleanse for my body. Mmmm!
One of my new favorite spots in Paris - a gem!Feels like eating at home - delicious and nutritious food - would eat lunch there everyday!

Our family lunch at this restaurant was a delight from start to finish. The delicious macrobiotic food, impeccable service, and very charming ambiance made for a memorable parisian experience.
My experience at this restaurant was nothing short of exceptional.

Name: Adam et Eve Caf√© - Restaurant V√©g√©tarien
Reviews: In Paris on holiday, we wanted to have a healthy but tasteful dinner and found this place. High quality, great taste and very well balanced. Service was very kind and polite!

We need more of this kind of vegetarian restaurants. An amazing assortment of appetizers. Very creative with the dishes. They were all so good. The main course salads seemed like bigger portions of the appetizer salad but tasted good nevertheless. The spicy carrots, eggplant in Japanese sauce and sweet potato appetizer were the highlights. Highly recommended!

Amazing food and atmosphere we really enjoyed it. Stumbled in after a long day and Adam et eve cafe was exactly what we needed. We had the spicy carrots as a starte (was absolutely scrumptious) and are still waiting in the incredible recipe. I had the crispy tofu balls with lentils and roasted cauliflower it was delicious and the textures were great. My friend had the garahamasala curry which was also very nice if a touch sweet for my taste overall we had a wonderful time and  the food was amazing and the service was top notch!
A borderline religious experience here at Adam et Eve Cafe. This is what a vegetarian restaurant should be. A deliciously modern combination of Western and Eastern flavors. Try it out!
Finding a Vegetarian Cafe in the heart of Paris was really a stroke of luck. We enjoyed our meal here. Keep up the good work.

Name: Season Square
Reviews:
NEW FAVORITE SPOT ALERT üì£

I LOVE this place! I found it by mistake, close to where I work, and I am blown away by how good, healthy and cheap the food is  !!
I ordered the Aioli burger, with fries and Aioli sauce (because... Aioli is life üòÅ). I couldn't believe it was vegan! the texture, the presentation, the taste, everything was just perfect.

Recommended üíØ

Visited this restaurant with my meat eating sister and even she enjoyed it.

The little restaurant is super cute, free water as well. The table and chairs are comfy. There's a lot of different food choices. I got the BBQ burger and it was insanely tastey. My sister also loved her burger and said it even tasted the same as a "normal burger".

I also had a chocolate cookie and it was really good. The food prices are completely reasonable and it's only a 15 minute walk away from the arena.

If I was ever back in Paris I'd go here in a heartbeat.

The BBQ veggie burger was so good! And I loved whatever the seasoning was on the grilled corn on the side. The freshly juiced drink that I picked was perfect. The staff was friendly and spoke English, and the place was clean with lots of space. Not far from the metro. It might be off the beaten path, but definitely worth going to. I'll go again for sure.

Probably the best vegetarian burgers in Paris. They have unique steaks, much better than the beyond burger one. I tried all the burgers on the menu, and all of them are amazing. I find the ones with the non fried steak better. My only complaint is that this place is rarely open.

Reasonable prices. Good quality & quantity.
I had gluten free burger, steakhouse fries, cold rooisbos, pannacotta, and almond latte. All for 20‚Ç¨ ¬´¬†100% vegan plus gluten free¬†¬ª
They are all Delicious!!

Name: Veggie lovers
Reviews:
Amazing flavors, relaxing atmosphere and friendly service - we had a fantastic vegan dinner. We read great reviews before going and I was wondering if I am setting my expectations too high, but in the end I would say the place did live up to the reputation and my expectations.

Note: If I have to pick one flaw, I would say - it would have been nice if the pita bread they served on the side was warm. Probably that‚Äôs not usually served along with the dishes and they just gave us because we specifically inquired about it, not sure. Anyway, even without that the dishes themselves were mind blowing! And because of that I would still give this 5 stars.

Service was quick. But my friends and I were the only customers at 6.45 on a Thursday evening.. my local friend brought his dog along but we were asked to sit outside.. he found this surprising as majority of restaurants allow his dog inside..  food was good , tasty and good value for money. Would recommend

Highly recommend this restaurant if you are a vegetarian or a vegan visiting Paris. Perfect after a visit to centre Pompidou. Big portions, fresh and tasty food, for a reasonable price! Staff is very friendly as well!

Tucked on a narrow little street we found this place. We were craving for something a bit different (no actual association with any kind of articular fare), so we went for Vegetarian. It happened to be so good, super tasty, great portions and pure Middle Eastern flavors! They happened to be Syrian and it shows! Next door they own the Shawarma Lovers restaurant‚Ä¶. Did not try it but since we are into any good kind of food, we will try it next time!

Had a great mezze platter. The two ladies managing the spot were so hospital and took time to understand what I needed (a break from rich local fare. Read: no cream, no butter, no meat) and got me what I needed.

For all of you who need break from French food, come here!!

Name: Riz Riz Marais
Reviews:
The staff were very friendly, and the restaurant is bright and clean. But sad to say that we were both disappointed with the taste of the food. I will said that it‚Äôs quite overpriced. I had the dragon curry, and while the sauce was not bad, no very special, there wasn't enough of it to make all the rice flavorful.

Doe the dessert, the cheesecake was not like expected at all, but the mango sticky rice was quite good, not very sweet which I like it.

We were very looking forward as the review were good, but sadly its an average restaurant.

I had a wonderful experience at Riz Riz! The gluten free options are amazing and delicious! I wished I was spending more time in Paris so I could come back a second time. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and the service was great!

Food was pretty good and service was pleasant. It's very casual and lacks ambiance. It's fine if you are looking for a quick basic plant based meal but it is not a dining experience. It's more of a cafeteria.

You can't really go wrong with a vegan restaurant called rice rice. The food, setting, and service all contributed to a fantastic dinner.

Riz Riz is conveniently located in Marais and has a fairly large space--a number of tables, many of which could accommodate larger groups. After checking for our reservation, my partner and I were quickly seated and offered the choice of an English menu (thank you!)

For food, we settled on the "rice table" which was a bit of a smorgasbord of several dishes on their menu. It came in 8 decent size bowls, with another bowl of rice for each of us. There were a few stew/soup style bowls (which were all delicious), some that focused on chickpeas or edamame, another with sweet potato waffles, and one with an incredible beet hummus.

If it sounds like a lot of food, it was, even for two people. We both walked away very filled up, though stomach's happy. Pricing was reasonable too, keeping the wallet happy as well. And if you want to keep the night going, there's plenty of places nearby to grab a drink. Cheers!

We came here two times in the same week. Me and my family (which has vegan and gluten free restrictions) really appreciated the good food and service as well. Quality is really good and portions abundant. The second time we came it was approaching closing time, but we were still welcomed, served and given the time to eat. Absolutely recommended :)
The shared table of all the options was AMAZING!!! My favorite meal in Paris so far! Such a variety of flavors with each dish.

Absolutely outstanding and super-fun vegan restaurant.

Massively original dishes with an African touch and a mad original genius touch.

Someone insane is in that kitchen -and we should be very happy that maniac is there.

If you are a normal reasonable rational person, you would order one of the dishes on the menu and be very very happy.

But they offer a rice table option where they will bring you a bowl of rice and bowls of EVERYTHING they got in the kitchen.

OMG.

Decadence on a stick!

Among dishes you will never forget:

1) Waffles with sweet potato and vegetables. Chicken and waffles has met its vegan version - and the vegan version is better.

2) The best spinach dal you will have in your life. Tastes more like spinach than anything spinachy you have ever had.

3) Beet Hummus. Beets make everything good. Even dipping food.

4) Mango Masala. Because sweet is good.

5) Dragon Curry. Time to have the top of your head blown off. But this is so so savory! You need a little mega-fire to keep everything balanced, right? This is a vegan establishment, so there is no actual dragon meat in the dish.

6) A tabouli that will make tabouli haters love tabouli.

7) Black Panther. Edamame and vegetables. A bland counter to the other crazy stuff. But don't miss the black rice at the bottom!

* * *

If you get the full rice table, you also get dessert.

Their chocolate peanut butter mousse is the peanut-iest dessert you will ever eat in your life.

They make everything from scratch in their own kitchen.

So peanut butter here just means ground up peanuts.

The chocolate is a binder and a "straight man" to play off the peanuts.

The chocolate is almost like the chocolate in a mole.

How is chocolate peanut butter mousse as a dessert?

Just as insane as everything else in this amazing establishment!

* * *

I am sure Paris has haute haute haute fancy vegan restaurants for people who just have to have fine crystal and expensive silverware and lots of ou-la-la.

I don't care how tootie-pa-snootie the room is so long as the food is good.

This was a vegan meal we are going to remember for the rest of our life.

Add to it the fun factor of eating all these different things on top of the same bowl of rice ...

And this is Vegan Party Time - Only Totally Gourmet!
Tasty and cozy. Friendly staff + Fair prices but they have to do something about their toilet‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a disaster‚Ä¶ as a lot of places in Paris unfortunately.

I went with some friends just for a dessert. We ordered the cheesecake matcha and the chocolate mousse. I think the restaurant must hire more waiters to serve the customers so we could have a better time at the restaurant.

Riz Riz was an unexpected gem!

Food was delicious: highly recommend the sweet potato waffle and the mango curry.

Service is friendly and food came out fast.

Prices are reasonable.

The restaurant is nice and very clean.

We'll definitely return!

Name: Love Juice Bar Tour Eiffel
Reviews:
09.12.2024

A hidden gem!  This place has fresh, wonderfully made juice and smoothies.  Additionally they have freshly made sandwiches.  This is one of the few places that have vegan options.  My sister has came a few times during our stay.

This is a pleasant atmosphere; however the physical seating area could use some work to make it more inviting. The service is excellent; they took the time to explain the menu.

I highly recommend this place.
Best avocado toast in Paris. There is lots of options for the bowls & protein drinks as well.

Very calm space to enjoy a vegan snack. The portions are quite small so our meal felt a little expensive compared to others we have had. It was very delicious though - keeping the menu small, I imagine this is consistent.

This is a brilliant little free-from cafe for people with allergies or intolerances. There's a really good food and drinks menu with a load of different juices and smoothies on offer. All the food items are gluten-free and vegan, and are absolutely delicious! As well as gluten and dairy, I also have a soya intolerance and there was only one thing on the menu I couldn't have - I'm not used to having so much choice! I went for the avo toast and a juice (both excellent) and then bought a cookie and a slice of cake as we left (also excellent!). The staff were incredibly friendly and very helpful navigating my dietary questions.

I couldn't recommend this cafe enough!

Great service and a√ßa√≠ bowl! The people working there were very nice and offered recommendations. It‚Äôs kind of hilarious that they try to charge an extra 2‚Ç¨ for peanut butter or almond butter, but the bowl was good without it. Plenty of seating inside and some tables outside as well.

I‚Äôm adding to the review after my second visit. Highly recommend the mango bowl. These are so good! The consistency is perfect; it‚Äôs like eating ice cream.

Name: GangNam Falafel
Reviews: Maybe we came on a bad day. Staff is super nice it‚Äôs clean. But the food is too much, so to much that it‚Äôs not pleasant to eat. I will not recommend this one sadly, i found the idea brilliant tho .

Staff was nice and friendly. It's a small very place.

+1 Star for letting me try the mushroom bowl wich was quite tasty.

I ordered the classic sandwich. Unfortunately I can't agree with anyone here, it was super oily and if I wouldn't be that hungry I would have needed to throw it away. It was like drinking from a oil bottle while eating it. On top Falafel was super dry.

Next day I had some stomach problems.

Friendly staff. Food was great and very large portions. Bring a friend. The falafel bowl was smashing. Mushroom bowl = üî•

Their lemon ginger drink was perfect.

Greeted by the lovely owner who offered us a sample of to try and explained the entire menu to us. The other staff member was welcoming and cheery. The food and hibiscus tea was amazing, rich in flavour and tasty !!!!! We will definitely be returning sometime soon :)

Amazing owner Nicky, super serious about her cooking. Great concept and delicious food. All her sauces are homemade with love. The portion is huge and super affordable for the price. You can eat healthy without comprising the taste and quality.
I took a mushroom bowl and my friend took the burger, we were so full we could barely walk.

Name: Itadakizen Paris
Reviews:
Lovely hidden gem! It‚Äôs a very cozy little restaurant with nice staff and really nice vegan food. We tried the spicy ramen (could have it everyday!) and the sushi.
Will definitely become a regular client!

I loved my experience here from start to finish!
First of all, I love the vegan menu here! Quite varied and everything I tried was tasty üå±üòä
I am so happy to finally taste a vegan panacotta!
And also their vegan sushi üç£ was my fav out of everything I tasted!

I am so amazed that it is all made by one person - there is only the lady owner working and serving. She is wow!

The place is quite tiny but it adds to the charm.
It has Studio Ghibli vibes !
Amazing, tiny Japanese vegan restaurant. Spicy ramen is great! Be prepared to wait a bit if you go during lunch hour because there are only 6 spots inside but it‚Äôs worth it.

Well located near the Buttes Chaumont, this small & authentic Japanese restaurant serves vegan dishes like ramens, bento boxes and sushi/makis. The food is fresh, home made and pretty good overall! The atmosphere is warm & friendly and you feel transported to a local joint in Japan!

Here in Paris and we went looking for some vegan maki or vegan sushi.

This place DOES NOT DISAPPOINT!
Very good presentation and taste. Portions were to be expected. Price was decent for Paris.

The only minor issue we had was seating. This is a micro restaurant that squeezes 6 people in only.

Customers visiting or bringing a party should know this ahead of time and ask for takeout.

Name: Charli's Crew
Reviews: Of all the places we tried, this was by far our favorite spot for vegan & vegetarian food in Paris. Very refreshing to find a place that isn't super heavy/only faux meats. Our favorite for  both the food and the customer service! We are traveling to London next and our sweet waitress made us a little handwritten list of the best vegan options as well as areas/places to visit. Amazing all around. üòä

highly recommend , a delightful gem in central Paris. This restaurant offers a refreshing twist on dining with its focus on fresh, organic, and healthy cuisine. The vibrant and innovative dishes are bursting with natural flavors, making every bite a delight. The staff are incredibly warm and friendly, adding to the overall charm. The inviting ambiance, filled with natural light and greenery, creates a perfect setting for a memorable meal. For a wholesome and unique dining experience in Paris, Charlie‚Äôs crew is an absolute must-visit

This place is absolutely fabulous. Everyone can find something to eat here. It‚Äôs especially fabulous for anyone looking for gluten-free and vegan options. They do offer some dishes that are vegetarian. They make gluten-free bread in house, but they also offer regular bread but not in house made

I had my favorite, which is the tofu scramble with the beautiful salad and warm small tomatoes. Everything was seasoned and cooked perfectly. My daughter had the chunacado sandwich With her homemade focaccia bread, which is gluten-free as well as vegan.   A new favorite dish of ours

Most of their bake goods are gluten-free and vegan. Their chocolate chocolate cookie is so good and they have a in house made snickers bar and bounty bar in the cold case. This is the way to eat, especially if you‚Äôre gonna go in for something sweet -  they use unrefined sugars too

We had hot chocolate with spices which included ginger and cinnamon. It was not spicy like spicy hot just perfectly balanced.  We also had golden hot shots. They serve them with a side of  apple slice  Some of my favorite hot shots ever.

I usually come to this place a couple of times every time I‚Äôm in Paris. I miss it when I am away.

Charlie, the owner with the beautiful smile and great energy is always helpful with me as I struggle with my French;  her first language is English as she hails from London

The staff is fantastic. Congratulate Charlie on creating such a fabulous addition to the Parisian food scene. Make a reservation for the weekend and enjoy their vegan eggs Benedict or get it with chicken eggs if you prefer. Benedict sauce is vegan, which is fantastic.

During the week you can just pop in.

The street is cute and not busy; enjoy their  tables outside.

They just celebrated three years. Congratulations and thank you again.

I really enjoyed in this place,it was great experience they have Gluten free option,and it stuff was very polite and friendly ,thats the reason I visited it twice in November and ,when I was back in December. Definitely my favorite brunch place in Paris!!

Name: SO NAT - Notre Dame de Lorette
Reviews: my favourite place to get lunch! it gets quite busy but it‚Äôs so worth it, the tofu bowl is absolutely exquisite i literally can‚Äôt get enough of it. also all girls are very very lovely and the place just radiates cheerfulness (i‚Äôm not even vegan but come here all the time)

After a long flight with No sleep I found this place a 10minute walk from my hotel and YUMMY!! Vegan and good amount of food.
No English menu but nice helping customers and workers and that translated for me. Got the first bowl with butternut squash
I couldn't help but eat a little before the photo

I had a nice bowl and sat outside. I enjoyed looking at the people walking by! Paris is such a lively city! I miss it already;-)

Btw do you know the ingredients for this bowl? I will try to recreate it around home!
Incredible food ! Wow ! What an amazing team and incredible food ! Thanks So nat !! We will come back !

Had high hopes for this place, especially because it's so hard to find vegetarian food in Paris, but unfortunately we were extremely disappointed.

We got one of the Buddha bowls with tofu, beet, lemon sauce, roasted carrots, spinach, and quinoa. The tofu was completely bland and basically just boiled, while the beets and lemon sauce were incredibly strong - to the point that they were inedible to me.

We also got a pita sandwich with seitan and vegetables. It was one of the blandest sandwiches I've ever tasted in my life - there were no spices, seasonings, or sauces.

Finally, we got a chia pudding and a rice pudding. They were both extremely bland and unenjoyable.

While it was at first exciting to find a veg restaurant in Paris, I would most definitely not be back.

Came here shortly before they closed, but was able to order a small bowl and eat comfortably outside. The Tofu Tout Flamme was one of their Buddha Bowls that caught my attention pretty quickly - I was intrigued by the fact that it is served over sticky rice, which is one favorite kinds of rice. It also had shiitake mushrooms in a sat√© sauce, marinated tofu, kobacha squash, plantains, and fresh greens. I definitely enjoyed every single bite.

The small bowl was perfect for a light lunch. I like when places give you the option of small and large portions, so that you don't end up spending money on food that you're not going to eat and will end up going to waste.

Many other items on the menu looked fantastic, too, so this will definitely be a place I come back to next time I'm in Paris.

Plant based cafe serving variety of bowls fittingly named Buddha and nirvana. Bowls come with grains/legumes/veggies and the array of gorgeous colors make it so IG worthy! Super tasty and filling, a large bowl with juice is 14euros. Everything is fresh and delicious and there was quite the lunch crowd. The ambiance of the cafe is cozy, adorable and filled with natural light and plants that makes it enjoyable to dine in. Food was prepared quickly, the only downside is that the cashier had limited English. Not a problem since everything looked amazing and I'm sure we could do no wrong ordering anything on the menu. Plant based dining exists and hope to see more of these cafes!!

I can't stop coming back to So Nat--it's just so delicious! It's a great cafe for filling, well priced, and well flavored healthy food. There are a few set bowls to choose from or you can create your own. So many options to choose from. The decor is cute and so nat is always packed full during lunch hours. Despite being a small cafe, I can usually always find a place to sit down.

I often order a bowl (‚Ç¨10) with bulgar , white bean msabbaha, sweet potato, kale, shaved cauliflower with figs, spinach, and tahini. Menu slightly changes frequently.

As vegetarians, it's often a challenge to find good dining options when we travel. However, we had such an incredible experience here, with a wide variety of delicious options to choose from. We absolutely love this place - we ordered quite a number of dishes on multiple occasions and every single dish was packed with flavour, plenty of choices to choose from. The service is both super friendly and quick. Highly recommended!

Outstanding address for vegan food - a historical rarity in Paris. Fresh and healthy bowls and pitas easy for healthy on the go eating. It's hearty, well priced and the menu rotates. The staff are an absolute gem. I can only suggest sitting on the small terrace in the sun. 10/10 recommend.

Name: Polichinelle
Address: 51/53 Quai de Grenelle RDC de l'Hotel Yooma, 75015 Paris, France
Reviews: Good place for vegetarian food. I was hungry from an entire day of sightseeing and went for dinner, a buffet for ‚Ç¨59. There were several small plates for appetizers, entree and dessert. I liked the cauliflower entree dish the most. The place had ample seating and was relatively empty on a Tuesday night.

Really enjoyed our meal here. It‚Äôs hard to get an upscale dining experience without meat but Polichinelle has got you covered. Amazing all vegetarian buffet which was so beautifully presented. Definitely worth going if you, like us, are visiting Paris and want to have one more memorable meal from your trip!
There are many options in the starters, main course and the desserts. We weren‚Äôt able to taste them all but whatever we tasted was top notch. Nothing disappointed and while pictures can‚Äôt do justice to the experience itself adding some to this review to give you a sense of what your meal might look like.

Ohh and a not so bad view of the Eiffel Tower from just outside the restaurant is a bonus for tourists :)

The best best vegetarian restaurant I‚Äôve ever tried.
They offer and open buffet of entr√©es, main dish and dessert, and they offer 5 diversities for each.
Food is just amazing and very well presented.
Staff is super nice and environment is so elegant and music is not high so you can enjoy it in the background will having talking and eating.
Totally recommend really worth it.

Best choice for vegetarian lovers...
The brunch there will really make any vegetarian person happy, we did it many times.
But my review and shots were from a special night dinner.
Excellent food, excellent presentation of dishes, excellent service behind the bars/buffet.

The service in the restaurant is average and depending on the waiteress so we feel it's not a Management standard to have high Customer Satisfaction (once we be well served with a smile, the other time we feel it's Parisian style service, just eat, don't talk to me and leave)

My 2nd remark concerns the pastries, when we go to Polichinelle (best pastry chef in the World Christophe Michalak) we expect more special/original pastries than the simple ones served in the buffet.

It's very expensive but consider it a fine vegetarian dining/brunch experience.

I add a lot of shots of almost all dishes and even the menu to help you get your own idea. Thank me later üòÅ
A must visit - incredible all vegetarian restaurant, every dish was very tasty! The staff were extremely helpful, one of the best restaurants we‚Äôve been to, definitely worth the price

I only took photos of the mains half way through my meal so they were not included in this post but the food was presented beautifully, only to augment their full aromatic flavour!

So tasty! It was hard to choose from the appetizing vegetarian menu, but I was so pleased with my delicious and filling feta salad. Happy to recommend this restaurant.

Name: mesa de HOY - PlantBased Restaurant
Reviews:
The food here was absolutely incredible. We shared the crudit√© and herb dip, which was lovely. My friend got the roasted vegetable consomm√© and I got the corn tortilla with avocado and salsa macha, and honestly it was one of the most wonderful things I've eaten recently. It made me so happy.

The waitress was very friendly and nice, and the wines were great. I want to come back to try the rest now.

A beautiful little restaurant with a flower shop in front and connected to the hotel. It feels a bit like Japan meets EO nature and Design, which we love. They did a great job and the seating is very comfortable.

The food is informed by Mexican food just a bit however hailing from California. It was quite different. Which was great. I very much enjoyed the complex and delicious flavors of my brunch savory dish, which was a corn tortilla with black beans, avocado and salad. It was so good.

I was ready to order a second one because it was a small dish size. ‚Ç¨17.

My companion got the sweet pancakes, which were just OK.

I had the turmeric golden milk, which was fine. It could‚Äôve been hotter, but I asked for extra hot water.

They ran out of towels at the bathroom for drying your hands and one of the gentlemen, not in the photo was on his phone so much it would‚Äôve been nice. Had there been a little bit more attention to service.

We would order the dish I had again for sure. And try to understand it subtle complex flavors. Absolutely fantastic. I hope they build their menu up a little bit more. So happy to have this place and it‚Äôs extra lovely with the flower setting in front.

The brunch menu is small and I had

The BEST vegan dinner we had in Paris! The tostada and celeriac starters were super fragrant especially with the fresh, edible flowers! We don't usually like polenta as normally it's stodgy and heavy but this was worth the chance, it was super tasty and ended up being our favourite main, the tofu cream is just insanely good. The almond, olive oil cake was out of this world, absolutely divine! My fiance was suprised by my Bruce Bogtrotter moment eating all of the cake! The kind of yummy where you have to close your eyes to experience the true taste! The ambience was peaceful, almost Bali esque vibes. We will definitely be returning when we next visit Paris. Thank you so much :)

Lovely space, lovely food. Nice without feeling pretentious.

‚Ç¨30 for the three course lunch seemed pretty good value.
Really lovely plant based restaurant! Lunch menu was a little small but the pasta was delicious! A little on the pricey side, but the inside was very nice and staff were very welcoming!

One of the best vegetarian burgers we ever had! It was very tasty. The truffle fries are also a great choice. We really liked this place.

We had an amazing experience here! Me and my partner are vegan but I‚Äôm also gluten free. The owner (I assume) said didn‚Äôt have any gf buns for the burger but insisted he would go get some right then. This is above and beyond for service we have gotten in Paris! My burger and bun was amazing and my husband enjoyed his meal as well. Highly suggest eating here whether you are plant based or not.

Name: Yoummah
Reviews:
It's difficult to find interesting and good quality food while traveling and Paris has many dodgy touristy restaurants on every corner.
Yoummah was a great find. It's a blend of Arabic North African cuisine- Tunisian, Algerian, Moroccan.
The decor is very calming. The ladies serving and cooking are charming and polite.
The food- we had the variety hummus plate. Unfortunately it was hard to distinguish between the various versions of hummus. Though I could feel that the food was good quality, it certainly packed in flavor.
Then I came for their aubergine dishes and that day the aubergine did not get delivered. Well, if it's 1/3 of your menu then how come there were no contingency plans? Meaning every grocery store sells good quality aubergine in France/Paris. A run to the grocery store would have done the trick....so disappointing.
I had the best food (similar type of food) in Essaouria, Morocco. The flavors there were unbelievably great.

Yoummah is a great place for middle-east food! I got the 35‚Ç¨ menu and was very satisfied with the amount of food but also the quality that came with it! You get a taste of their different appetizers + a choice of main dish + dessert! The portions are huge and I left the restaurant completely full :) the only small regret is the lack of nicer desserts, their current ones have nothing too special, but I will definitely come back!

A ver nice place with a lay down atmosphere in a calmer street. The decoration is lively and the staff is really friendly. All dishes were good and had interesting flavours. The story behind the restaurant is heartwarming and knowing that everything is done in house with fresh ingredients is a blast.

This place is hidden treasure! We ordered many dishes and literally all of them were extremely delicious!!!!!!!! The 2 ladies there were soooo nice, helpful and kind thanks a lot to them. I would highly recommend this place to anyone going to Paris
The dishes are incredibly delicious and well seasoned. It's a restaurant that I will keep going back to.

Name: Happiz Monge
Reviews:
Some traditional and non-traditional flavors. The vegan merguez was so good! It was described as sausage and tasted like pepperoni. The vegan bacon was also yummy! Those from the states who eat the frozen Annie's vegan pizza bites will like the the vegan mozzarella, especially with the vegan merguez!
The red wine and rose were also very good!
Delicious pizzas with great vegan cheese (cow cheese also available), fresh vegetables and various mock meats. Friendly staff. We hope to eat here again before leaving Paris!
Delicious food! Loved the vegan pizza and vegan dessert.

The Vegan scene in Paris is mediocre, but this restaurant is definitely not. The food here was great. The atmosphere was nice and the service was excellent.

We opted for a custom vegan pizza and my wife decided on the soup, which she loved. My son and I thought the pizza was fantastic.

Prices were affordable, hours are very Parisian and the food was delicious. Highly recommend.

5/5.

Friendly service, many vegan options and nice house wine. The build your own pizza was a success, particularly the dough which is thin but fluffy where it counts üëå Wait was around 25min at peak dinner time service (after 8pm) which is perfectly reasonable. ‚Ç¨36 for 1 large, 1 medium and 2 red wine. Bring cash for tips. Will be back, thank you! üôèüòò

Service was great, and even though it was almost a full restaurant and we didn‚Äôt have a reservation front of house kindly accommodated us. Portions are very good-sized so you get your money‚Äôs worth. Also loved the complimentary ginger shot we got given before the meal. Hope to come back to try the gluten-free pastries!

Fine, but the fact that they never came and checked on me after they delivered the food, especially before the kitchen closed - It wasn‚Äôt very busy. We are towards the end of August.    I was speaking French  though  poorly.

Name: brEAThe Montorgueil - VEGAN SUSHI BAR
Reviews:
A small vegan sushi restaurant with a very relaxed atmosphere and amazing food.

It's not traditional, but it doesn't tries to be. It's fresh, innovative, creative and delicious. The many different tastes you get will stay in your memories forever.

After some very good Ramen we wanted more, so we went with different sushi. We got blown away by the complexity of the chefs creation, it was simple yet so overwhelming.

The service was on point and had an eye on everything, we immediately felt welcomed.

We will definitely come back for more!

As a non-vegan, I was skeptical about the taste and texture of the sushi at brEAThe Vegan Sushi, but I was pleasantly surprised. The menu changes frequently, so I can't recommend one specific dish, but if you visit when they have the vegan omelet, it's definitely worth a try‚Äîit tastes just like the real thing! The crispy seitan could use a bit more seasoning, but overall, the experience was delightful. The innovative flavors and fresh ingredients made for a memorable meal. Highly recommended for both vegans and non-vegans alike!

Great sushi üç£ and a big variety of it. The staff was friendly and quick. It‚Äôs a small but cosy place. They have a few tables to sit outside.
I will definitely come back.

Beautiful experience, very lovely staff! The food was great! The cheesecake had to be my favourite by far! Tasted just like the real deal! Thoroughly enjoyed the sushi and the pepper sauce was lovely and creamy!  The Oyakadon was super flavourful and highly recommend!
One of the best Sushis I have even tried especially the fried one. Would def go back for more! Each sushi has a unique flavour

Name: Mori caf√©
Reviews:
One of the best, if not THE best lunch I've ever had.
It's a full vegan Japanese restaurant.
Food is really well cared for, both aesthetically and in terms of ingredients.
Overall everything is really clean and it has a good ambiance.

I'm considering coming back to Paris just to eat here again.

This place is perfect for vegans and vegetarians. If you‚Äôre a meat-eater, the appeal can be slightly reduced. The service is very fast and friendly. The chefs are Japanese and the food is good, but not outstanding. I would say this is more like a vegan version of Japanese fast food; in particular, the Udon salad sauce and the pickled onions are a bit too salty for my taste. If you‚Äôre used to outstanding Japanese food from coastal towns of the U.S., you might be slightly disappointed. Still, I would say it‚Äôs good Japanese food by Paris standards, and excellent by vegan standards. Portion-size is a bit small for the price. American Express accepted.

This was the best dining experience we had in Paris...and we had some good ones. The flavours- delicious! The service- the finest The ambience - perfection! Most importantly our little boy ate more at this meal than any other. He devoured the tofu tapa and then the soy protein and rice bowl. He also sampled our soups and would have eaten those too if we hadn't objected.
Highly recommend!

Best place in Paris! The tantanmen was incredible - so rich and creamy. In addition, the space was so unique, cozy, and beautiful. I sat on the tatami upper level and had a great time enjoying the space and food. You must come here!

We got Tantanmen ramen (17.5‚Ç¨), Teriyaki Don (16‚Ç¨) and Edamame (4‚Ç¨). Tantanmen has a tasty thick bouillon with beyond meat. They serve good vegan japanese food.

My second time, I tried the miso ramen, I think tantanmen is better in terms of bouillon taste. Miso ramen is lighter. We didn‚Äôt like the cafe gourmand except the matcha cookie, but the flan was good.

Name: Le Mezze du chef √ßig k√∂fte
Reviews: I don't speak French, and the manager was very patient and helpful and extremely friendly as he helped me with the menu. The food was tasty, reasonably-priced, and presented beautifully.

You should definitely try the cigkofte (which is a turkish vegan dish made with bulgur, tomate paste and spices)! It tastes so good and is a nice reasonably priced vegan meal. Plus the owner and the service is great, you feel at home.

For the desert, I suggest the cafe gourmand with pistachio or the cafe gourmand normal which contains a turkish coffee and small parts of desserts.
Amazing service and food. This is one of my favorite places to eat in Paris. The staff are incredibly friendly and the food is always perfect.

Everything that I tried from the lentils soup, to the b√∂rek and cig kofte tasted fresh, delicious and was authentically Turkish. The prices are very affordable and I would definitely return to this restaurant!

If you would like to try true and delicious Turkish food; this is the place!! Great service, the owner is very kind and atmosphere makes you want to come back. It is my 10th time here, and surely I will come back!

Got takeaway b√∂rek here because I was craving some (I‚Äôm half Turkish) and it was amazing! The owner was so lovely, he gave me some of their handmade √ßiƒü k√∂fte to try and I tell you it is the best I have had! I will definitely be getting some more of the k√∂fte another time. They have good meal deals too. Highly recommend ‚ô•Ô∏è

Love it, the food was fresh and delicious!
We got the vegan mezze for 2, and it was very satisfied.

Overly hip. Overly designed presentation of food that is available in so many simple Turkish restaurants around town. No indication that the owner/chef knows anything about traditional country Turkish vegetarian and vegan fare. A real disappointment for me. The prices, however, were reasonable. Finally, an extremely uncomfortable sitting experience.

Name: Mopa Sentier
Reviews: Very good vegan food! Small menu that changes regularly. I had one of the best plant-based sausages ever, and coming from a German that's saying something! We got in without a reservation on a Wednesday evening, I guess booking a table is advised towards the weekend as the restaurant is quite small. Friendly staff. Great cocktails too!

Excellent food, creative, and flavorful.  Sit down restaurant with fast table service and has a toilet.  Not touristy!  There was no English menu and everyone else in the restaurant was speaking French.  The menu is short ‚Äî 6 savory and 3 sweet ‚Äî and rotates every season.  I loved it.  It was not the best place for my 7yo ‚Äî the food was too interesting! ‚Äî but my 10yo enjoyed the arancino.  Eating a giant fried ball appealed to him!

Lovely lovely lovely vegan food in a cute little cafe setting. The ambience is perfect and food is soooo delicious! I had the Japan bowl and the salad, vegan chicken and portobello were just perfection. Service was friendly and prompt. Enjoyed my lunch a lot. Keep up the good work and highly recommended!

Awesome vegan place with really filling and tasty food! We tried the arancini, cold beast burger, and doner kebab. The portions were very filling and the flavors were incredible. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Name: Joy In Food
Reviews: Delicious, healthy home-cooked food - we got the plat du jour, the soup and some vegan cakes and loved all of them. It smells SO good when you walk in - the kitchen is right there and you can tell all of the food is prepared fresh. It can be hard to find good vegetarian / vegan options in Paris so we were thrilled to find this place. The owners are very sweet and even gave us a little present for our baby. I thought that the prices were very reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food. Cash only but there is an ATM around the corner. Would highly recommend!
We went today and were pretty happy. The food was excellent, super tasty, and the environment relaxed and cozzy. Can highly recommend.
What a jewel! Delicious food, well-sized portions, relaxed atmosphere, and great service. My partner and I are vegan and had plenty of options. Hope to come back!

üå±Wow - incredibly beautiful energy the owners have. I can't speak French, and they very little English - however they made me, a female solo traveller, feel most welcome and catered to.
üå±They suggested the cold plate with gazpacho as it was a very hot day. It was a delicious mix of salad, grains and pasta with falafel. 10/10 recommend.  I've tried to re-create the cold plate at home, but it's not quite the same! They obviously have some secret ingredients.
üå± I chose a gluten free cherry cake for dessert, which was a bit like a sweet English crumpet.
üå±The restaurant itself is very quaint and lovely.
üå±This experience really made my trip! Thank you so much. I will be back.

Name: Jo and Nana Cakes
Reviews: A really nice little place. I stumbled in and had the pancakes and a cold drink - delicious and a huge portion! The lady who runs the cafe was very warm and accommodating - I had a sleeping toddler in the pram so she made space for me to sit comfortably at the side.

Really outstanding brunch experience. It's ‚Ç¨31 per person when you choose any of the nicer cakes (worth it for the Paris Brest) - a lot of money, but worth it for high quality vegan food and drink with understated excellent service. The teas were a revelation, particularly the smoked one.

If you‚Äôre vegan and in Paris this is a MUST visit!
I have never had such amazing vegan patisserie before. It was one of these ‚Äúcan you check it‚Äôs really vegan moments‚Äù üòç
I took it to go and was in a rush and the lovely lady stopped what she was doing and packed this lovely selection for me. The ones with the strawberry on top are INCREDIBLE!!!!ü§§‚ô•Ô∏è
Thank you so much!! üíï

Reposting this review, Visited in April 2023:

What an amazing find! Was drawn in by the cute name and found it was fully vegan was a great surprise! The lemon tarte was so fresh and cleansing. The tiered strawberry cake was light for a vegan sponge, and the compote gorgeous. üçì

If you're vegan in Paris, this is a definite for bucket list eateries~

Jo and Nana are famous for their vegan patisserie and I have to say the place totally lives up to the hype.

Last week I bought a pistachio Cruffin there and it was delicious! The pistachio Creme was rich and not too sweet and the dough of the Cruffin nice and soft on the inside and crispy on the outside.

I work close to this place - I will need to make sure I won‚Äôt gain too much weight ü§£

The place itself looks very cute and the service at the counter was very friendly helping me to choose between all the delicious things they offer.

Definitely highly recommended, especially for vegans!

Name: Bobun Break
Reviews: We were super hungry on the way to the Museum of Evolution and were looking for a good takeaway and decided to give this place a try. Staff were friendly and upon opening our takeaway, while sitting on the benches in the park, we were genuinely surprised by the large portions. The food was delicious. One of the best Chicken Bun Ga Nuong we‚Äôve had. Portions for the price were 2x more than what we get in London and the ingredients were very fresh tasting and well balanced.

I ordered takeout from Bobun Break chicken meal  and beef meal and was thoroughly impressed. The food was exceptionally delicious, with authentic Vietnamese flavors, and the service was outstanding. Despite the rain, the staff prepared my order with care and even lent me an umbrella, showing their thoughtful customer service. Highly recommended!

Absolutely in love with the food here! Affordable decent Vietnamese taste. I had a vegan version and it was amazing, plus for the big portion. From my experience, if the vegan tastes good, then the original one cant be doubted. They‚Äôre so nice to carefully explain to me how the vegan meat looks alike to the real meat and the ingredients they use so i can rest assure i get the right order. Definitely gonna come back for more. Thank you for making my lunch enjoyable üòã

5 stars all day long. This was a random stop looking for a good snack on our last night in Paris. The owners were super friendly and the food was amazing. If you are staying near by absolutely go here for take out and sit by the river. The balance of fish sauce, sugar, and spice are perfect on all their dishes!

This place is incredible!!! We are visiting from the US and are staying next to this place so we stopped in. This is the best Vietnamese food my husband and I have ever had! You need to try the spring rolls! They remind me of the rolls my friend's mom made when I was growing up. Until now I've never been able to find one like it. The staff is so kind and the owner clearly cares about the food he serves. We will definitely be back multiple times before we leave!

Name: Loving Hut Paris
Reviews: It's hard to rate objectively when you've experienced Loving Hut in Prague. Actually none of Loving Huts outside Prague I've visited (London, Amsterdam, here) was remotely comparable with Prague's Huts in every aspect: variety of dishes, taste, exotic combination of ingredients, price. Anyways, the mister that served us was very nice and polite, food was good, place was a bit uneasy. But definitely worth the try if you're testing vegan restaurants in the town.

Wonderful vegan spot in Paris. I had the spring rolls as an appetizer and the pho. The pho was amazing, lots of greens and there was soy protein (kind of like faux beef) that was sososo good and exceeded my expectations. Service was fast and friendly. Highly recommend and can‚Äôt wait to go back.

Lunch today here. As a matter of fact this is my first time in this place. Sushi starters were really good, now waiting for the main. English spoken here, good and fast service. We were told to sit on a table for two (we first tried to go to a table for four), I guess this place will get packed in any moment now....

I've been to several Loving Hut locations around the world and this one lives up to the standard of reliably good food. I got the mushroom crepe and a veggie sushi special with mock meat that a unique and delightful spin on vegan sushi.
Love this place! Highly recommend the Cha Cha ocean and the vegetable, tofu and noodles üòçüòçüòç‚ú® very nice staff and the food is incredible.

Name: Jimmy's Street Food
Reviews: Jimmy‚Äôs Street Food is awesome! We tried their loaded tenders, mac no‚Äô cheese, and Caesar salad during our first visit here. The Caesar salad was not what I was expecting for a traditional Caesar, but we still enjoyed it. Service was great and the food was served very quickly! Portions are very generous (between two people, we couldn‚Äôt finish all the food). The highlight by far was the giant vegan chocolate chip cookie we ordered for takeaway (it took the two of us a few days to finish it)!

Amazing vegan junk food restaurant with reasonable prices + tasty and big portions! I tried the sub sandwich with seitan which was huge. Liked the sandwich but didn‚Äôt like the wings however the taste of their stick, cinnamon sticks? was too strong for me. Anyways I recommend the place, I think it‚Äôs a good vegan option :) near the Montmartre area.

If you like street food you should definitely pay Jimmy a visit when in Paris! If you are a vegan and it is Monday it should be compulsory; then they serve an "all you can eat" offer for 19 euro. That means you get the chance to try everything on the menu, although I recommend subsequent orders since it is likely you will fill up fast! Loved the home made tenders (seitan, try it with the Ceasar dressing) and the cheeseburger. Go for it!

Cheap junk vegan food. Great price and friendly staff. Cheez burger and caesar salad was good. The wings‚Ä¶ great idea and presentation - nice use of jackfruit - but smells strongly of cinnamon, which is not my thing. Also, their cookies are huge!

We had some vegan tenders, sub sandwich and sweet potato fries. The tenders were fine even though kinda 'starchy'; in terms of flavor they can certainly be improved though. The sub sandwich is good and vegan cheese is quite realistic, but the bread was a bit mushy. The fries were what I like best: cruchy and flavorful. The meal is pricy but as Paris is not yet that vegan-friendly, I find it acceptable. Service was friendly! Overall a quick fix if you are vegan/vegetarian but miss the idea of fast food! üòâ

Name: Le Macareux
Reviews: We visited one night not knowing that most of our party would not be able to eat the home-made bread (nut allergy), but Florence was incredibly friendly and accommodating. In particular the gourmand salad was a beautiful combination of flavors and textures. The restaurant is well down a road off a popular strip, but is certainly worth the trip down the street to visit.
A real discovery! Organic, local, homemade, and above all healthy cuisine (they have their own bread).
Came for a concert, tried the food, great home made bread!!!

Expensive, order process not very human friendly. And they don‚Äôt declare VAT? Tax fraud?
I still remember this burger that I ate 2 year ago and this is probably the best thing that I‚Äôve ever ate in my life

Absolute trash.  Ordered off Uber Eats, took an hour and a half.  Arrived FREEZING COLD with missing items that I had paid to upgrade.  Wasn‚Äôt edible.  Uber EATS Refunded me ‚Ç¨3 for the upgrade, but not for the rest of the side that was missing, nor for the cold disgusting food.  Insulting!  Avoid at all costs and avoid Uber Eats as well!

Name: New Jawad Longchamp
Reviews:
The best Indian /Pakistani food I've had in over 5 years.
Best Indian/Pakistani food in Paris
Delicious curries
Delicious pakora
Delicious lassi
Perfect / generous portions - you will not leave feeling hungry
The atmosphere is beautiful and the service is professional and friendly.
Very affordable prices.

Super classy restaurant , in Paris for 6 days but didn‚Äôt find a fine dine like this . Good food and spice level was made to order ‚Äúspicy‚Äù. Great service and friendly staff took good care of us as we were missing good Punjabi Indian food. Deserts in the picture were amazing, didn‚Äôt get chance to take food pics as they were gone by the time I got to my camera. Overall, a great fine dine Indian food in the heart of Paris, 5/5

We entered the establishment on a Saturday night. Very busy as it's situated in the centre of Paris. They found us a table very quickly.

Staff are very attentive and friendly. The place was bustling and you can see the locals dine here too.

Food was pricey, but this was expected with it being in the centre and so close to the Eiffel. Drinks arrived promptly with poppadoms and chutney. Not sure and wasn't really fond of the banana and mango chutney two flavour which should not be mixed.

Food came and was pretty nice. Lamb and chicken curry was nice. Portion sizes were extremely small. This was expected. We ordered everything spicy but it was a tad sweet for us. Especially the vindaloo.

However, had a great time and would recommend giving this a try again. Decor was beautiful and reminded me of the old themed restaurants. Very classy. Staff were friendly and I loved it.
Best Indian/Pakistani food in whole of Paris. But treatment to foreigners and Indians was bit different.  Everyone got their papad except me who paid for a whole lunch set.

The best Indian Food I‚Äôve had in entire Paris. Every single item in the menu is worth the try. The butter chicken is the highlight of the menu. Delicious vegetarian food as well. The owner and staff is very very very friendly. They go out of the way to make you feel comfortable. I will definitely visit them again when I‚Äôm in Paris.

I‚Äôve traveled entire France, but no Restruant can beat there food.

The best part of the restaurant is their hospitality. The way they make you feel with there amazing service and the food.

I will definitely will rate this more than 5 if given an option.

Name: India StreEAT
Reviews:
Went to one of the best Indian restaurants outside of ‚Äúlittle India‚Äù in the 10√®me, called India StreEAT. The owner Thomas called it StreEAT because he was a child from the streets back in Bengal. A truly heartwarming story from the poor streets of India to becoming a restaurateur. A must go to in the 5eme.

The food was delicious. Lots of rich flavors. I particularly liked the Saag lamb and the saag paneer. Interesting, their achar (pickled accompaniment) was more of a sauce,  which we really enjoyed.‚Ä®‚Ä®Thomas is very warm, amicable and welcoming. It‚Äôs not always about the food, but the people who make the restaurant, n‚Äôest-ce pas? ‚Ä®‚Ä®Would we go back, ABSOLUTELY.

I have been to Indian restaurants all over the world and never experienced anything quite like this. There is a very personal touch to the service and a very delicate taste to the food. It‚Äôs affordable and delicious and English is not a problem here. Hopefully one day they bring this restaurant to Florida.
Phenomenal food. We got a couple appetizers and some mains. Side sauces were homemade and fresh. Super cute ambiance as well. Definitely would come back.

Flavorless and very far from real Indian cuisine.
Portions where also not very generous.

Palak paneer: not much flavor, no garlic, ...
Dal makhani: tasteless. 0 spices (garam masala), a flavor of heinz tomato sauce, super liquidy,
These are the 2 top classics and not that difficult to make, so we were very disappointed. Won't recommend the restaurant unfortunately.
Naan was good. Paratha was deep fried...

But very nice staff and cosy atmosphere.
Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Really good value for money too. Definitely worth a visit!

Name: BAO & ME
Address: 89 Rue du Faubourg Poissonni√®re, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews: Great food. Great service. Friendly staff. They brought us English menus and were super friendly. The food was very unique and so tasty!

Friendly staff and excellent English speakers! The food is amazing, high quality ingredients and home made chips to compliment an amazing looking and tasting burger. I would recommend anyone to visit here! They also offer to put a hashbrown on your burger, do it. It tastes amazing. Not many tables so come early or reserve a table. Very well done BAO & ME!
We arrived without a reservation, but still got a seat straight away. The seating area downstairs is a little dark and cramped, but the food arrived very quickly and was tasty!

The restaurant is highly regarded on Tripadvisor so we decided to give it a try.

We were pleasantly surprised by its charming, laid back personality. The staff was accommodating with English menues and took our orders promptly. We then found a table (self-seating) with the food following us shortly after. The meals were fresh and most importantly delicious! I have never had a ramen burger this good! The unique flavour combination is distinctly memorable.

We are glad we decided to visit this restaurant and would highly recommend it! The price is also very reasonable for the area.

To begin with:
- very small space, but they have outside as well
- reserved always or go very very early
- they have seasonal bao burger for the love of the Bao God. üòç
- the girl was super nice to me and the guy at the cashier either
- the burger don't have fries included. You choose your side dish for you alone or to share with your friends
- bubble tea with tapioca pearls are sooooo good. I took a pi√±a colada with mango pearls.
I order two burger: seasonal Halloween and the black charcoal with goat cheese and zucchini. The best burger on the men√π.

Name: Le Stand
Reviews: Delicious, 10 stars really. A must if you‚Äôre in Paris. Prepare to fall in love with the flavor of fresh and daily selected ingredients. Everyday the menu changes, keeping you‚Äôre taste buds excited and happy.

This is a small counter restaurant inside the March√© de Enfants Rouge.

One of the best meals we had in Paris. The charming and even more hard working owner makes incredibly fresh incredibly delicious food. The Saturday brunch is a generous portion of carefully constructed yet comforting and filling vegetarian food. Even our kids loved the bright and simply but deliciously flavored lentil and cauliflower salad and of course the loved the fresh juice, excellent brioche, croissant sandwich, and fried potatoes.
Super tasty - Great Team! Love the veggie stuff! They even speak a lot of languages

This was my favorite food experience in Paris.  Whereas other tasty meals I‚Äôve had in this city depended heavily on salt, my lunch at Le Stand was more about carefully balanced flavors.

I was especially impressed with how the dish took an ingredient I tend to dislike (olives) and made it super delicious.  The flavors of the fresh pressed juice were also fun and bright (apple, pineapple, and fennel).

My only regret was that I didn‚Äôt let myself order any of their delicious looking desserts, but I guess that‚Äôs what next time is for!

Le Stand is the place to go to get daily changing vegetarian and vegan food. Every day something different. Every day a different well balanced dish and changing desserts. Several weeks of eating there almost every day for lunch and I have not seen anything repeat yet and every fish was delicious.
Now during the winter the staff is so warm and welcoming in their little outdoor kitchen that you stop feeling the cold.
If you haven't tried it yet and are looking for vegetarian or vegan or are looking a delicious home cooked meal, then go there!

The most incredible place for vegan and vegetarian food! I‚Äôm a meat lover and I didn‚Äôt even think about it while I was drooling over their food! Amazing food, service, and atmosphere üî•‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è!
Great place for a quick gluten free and vegetarian meal, and delicious too! Sit at the bar or tale away.
Great food, light and healthy without all the commonly used butter around. Limited menu, changing daily.

Le Stand is BAAACK! Lovely tomato/watermellon salad today! I have missed you guys!

Maxima
Great tiny cafe hidden away from the crowd in Marais. Tres cool! Definitely try the brownie cheesecake hybrid it's delicious. Only wished we have more tummy space.

Name: FOR THE LOVE OF FOOD PARIS
Reviews:
We had a lovely evening at For the love of food. The concept is a set menu in an open kitchen featuring two different chefs and menus. To chose your menu you ask and watch what the chefs are doing. You tailor the pace of your dishes by giving the chefs a card when you feel ready to have the next dish. We had a Moroccan chef and a Hait√≠ one. Really original and nicely presented dishes.
The chefs are on rotation every 1-3 months so the food is never the same.
The owner gives you a warm welcome and everything feels homey, unpretentious and good.

The food and the entire experience here was spectacular. I got lucky and got to sit in the kitchen because I was dining alone. This place is an incubator that rotates chefs.. I also got lucky that Chef Todd , who is also the founder of the place was in charge this month. This place makes excellent use of fresh ingredients and is innovative too. The cauliflower gnocchi was an example of this. Still reeling! One of my favorite food experiences in Paris!

Wonderful fresh spring menu.
Excellent service by the staff. Really felt welcomed here.

I reduce one point as I still felt hungry for more after the meal. (Of course the meal was delicious)
Perhaps the starter portion size could have been bit bigger.

Until next time!

This place has a rotating cast of 3 chefs in a theme. Our visit was during the ‚Äúby the beach‚Äù theme. The chefs were from seychelles, Ivory Coast and copa cabana brazil.

The chefs prepare food on the 3 chefs tables and you can see how passionate they are about the food.

This is among the best places i have ever eaten at.

It‚Äôs probably the best brunch in paris! I had a great experience in terms of the food and the service. The Sunday brunch menu is definitely one of the most unique ones and is super reasonably priced. This place really is all about the food and their menu changes each season, we tried the printemps menu and honestly can‚Äôt wait to go back and try the summer menu üíõ

Name: East Side Burgers
Reviews: This place is absolutely amazing. Upgrade to the beyond meat beef burger, you wont be sorry - it will be the best vegan burger you've ever had. Excellent music too. The best bands eat here when they play Paris ü§ôüèº - kudos for going fully vegan too üñ§
Pretty good, quite interesting beyond meat burger. Fries are ok not so much here. But overall a bit overpriced.

Small fast food joint with many vegan options for burgers and hot dogs. The bun is amazing! Combo for burger,fries and drink is 12 euros. Fries were absolutely delicious, crispy on the outside and soft pillowy on the inside. They have a handful of vegan dessert which we tried the peanut butter cheesecake and banana chocolate tart. Delicious!! Elated that Paris has vegan options and extremely tasty ones nonetheless! Service is very friendly, cashier obviously caught on we were American and offered an English menu. Fast, delicious, very affordable vegan burgers and desserts. Please keep supporting vegan businesses!!

Nice burger (8 euros) , big enough and vegan. You can even ask a vegan cheese on option üëç

The service is good.
The only bad point for me was the bread of the burger if it was fresh it will be perfect .

Having failed to get into Deux Fois Plus de Piment (on a Friday night, of course this would happen without a reservation), we wandered back past the Boudin Noir on offer at Diablito Latino and decided to see what a vegan burger is at East Side Burgers.

With a variety of choices, I opted to try the vegan bacon with cheeseburger. It was... uh...: relatively small (which is good); the patty tasted vaguely of beans, the cheese of cheese, and the bacon was an amusing colour but didn't taste of much. Not sure what could have made it taste better; it was a fair imitation of a fast-food burger but... I wouldn't be rushing back to try their other burgers though.

I would have liked to try their homemade coleslaw (I love a good coleslaw) but they were sold out. The fries were awesome though; very crisp and with an addictive quality about them. Nom nom.

Points for contributing to a healthier planet, and in a hipster atmosphere (the outside table looked nice, the posters on the walls were fun)... The burger was two stars, but the fries and ambience bring this review up to three.

A lovely vegan/vegetarian place with a bit of an indie-rock flair. Easygoing and quick. Delicious and satisfying burger menu (in pic the garlicky "proven√ße" with fries and 7up). Coleslaw unfortunately not vegan. If you have time and want dessert grab a piece of cake if possible, too! :)

Came here the other day with some friends. I don't eat meat besides chicken so a friend had found this place. I was really excited to try. The burgers were ‚Ç¨7 and if you got the meal i believe it was ‚Ç¨11 or ‚Ç¨12 that included fries and a drink. I had just ate so I opted for just a burger. I ordered the Le Basque (comes with a patty of choice, lettuce, cheddar cheese, caramelized red peppers) I ordered it with a setan* patty.

*if you've never tried satan before its 100% gluten and its really hard for your body to digest*

I wasn't crazy about the burger, the cheese seemed to be like fake american cheese in plastic sheets. And I would have prefered carmelized onions over red peppers. But within a few hours I got very sick to my stomach. Luckily with some research, it turned out to be from the setan. Which has nothing to do with the restaurant but just how my body reacted to it. What I'd love to see is a veggie burger thats made with vegetables and not tofu and setan.

Menu looked very good, especially the appetizers. Would deffinitly come back to try other items!

The staff was friendly and helped me pick my vegan burger. I loved the atmosphere and branding of the company. Cool, sort of hipster-like. I opted for take out of a vegan bacon cheese burger with fries and a drink for ‚Ç¨11.

The burger was average in size and the cheese was really great. I loved it. Even though I opted for takeout, the fries were still crispy by the time I got to my hotel. The burger though, wasn't a fake meat patty, like I might expect in some American burger joints. This burger was more mushy. Not my thing, I like a fake meat burger. The taste was great though, so I do recommend it.

I'd definitely come back again and try some of the other vegan options, like hot dogs or cakes. Recommended!

We popped in here around lunch time while on vacation. I really wanted to try this place, it was on my to do list. It was great! We shared the Marcello and the East Side with fries. Both were so tasty, I am always on the hunt for the best veg burgers and this place has got them! Don't forget to try the homemade coleslaw and there is also a great selection of desserts.
Bonus, it's right next to the metro Saint Ambroise.

One of the best if not the best vegan burger I had in Paris
I went with my wife (both vegans) and we had two of the burgers that were available (Fromager and Proven√ßal)
They both tasted great and filled us with veggie goodness
Even if you fill full afterwards, I urge you to take some of their deserts. They are homemade and delicious !! We had their 'cheesecake' and we loved it!
Recommend 100% for vegans !
Btw everything can be made vegan (just ask the friendly staff for it)

Name: Cantine 71
Reviews: The best couscous and tajine at a fair price in Paris, I‚Äôve tried quite a few places and and the couscous here is very fresh. The couscous royal was really good, I really loved the kefta too. The poulet tajine was also so flavourful, I definitely recommend trying the food here ü•ò

was in the mood for a bite to eat before grabbing some drinks, and happened up this delightful little moroccan joint. the kafta couscous was superb, served piping hot and alongside a bowl of slightly-sweet, lightly-spiced soup. my friend and i ended up coming back later (open late, also a bonus!) to get a sandwich, which i was assured was ‚Äúvery good.‚Äù very attentive and friendly staff as well. thanks for the meal!

Right off of Montorgueil, I stumbled upon a small restaurant with a sign advertising it's homemade couscous... It sounded good on a cold night and I was not disappointed. They made my chicken and vegetable couscous fresh. It was generous portion and was delicious. The staff was friendly and I appreciated the complimentary mint tea. I will be back again when I am in the mood for couscous. They look like they have other dishes too... I might try one of those next time.
Cozy place & very good food and service. I highly recommend !
Unbelievably good. Chicken tagine was outstanding. Very reasonable prices for Paris.

Name: Krishna
Reviews: As a local guide this was perhaps one of the best meals I‚Äôve eaten in france period. Perhaps I‚Äôm partial to Indian and perhaps I‚Äôm partial to vegetarian. But holy smokes.  I got the thaali and it was very affordable, quick. Tasty. Good service.  The eggplant was insane. So many flavour suited for a local guide.  I‚Äôll definitely be back asap!!!!!!!!!!

The food was delicious but the portions were so small that it felt more like degustation than dining. I would consider ordering two plates of whatever you are ordering otherwise you will stay hungry. Another point to consider - the spiciness level is adjusted to the European taste and I actually missed breaking at least a tiny bit of sweat while eating my butter chicken. The quality of food was good but zero spice anywhere.
Food taste is good. They prepare food after you place an order for whatever is possible. Honesty on service. But not good space. Their toilet is clean.

I had ordered a drink (tea) and an appetizer. The server told me that we don‚Äôt serve the tea until you order a main course. I was left aghast. I totally felt unwelcomed at the restaurant.

The appetizer was quite oily too.

I am just happy I was served my tea and appetizer and not asked to leave. I will not recommend visiting this restaurant.

Very very reasonable prices, good variety of Indian Veg & Non-vegetarian dishes. Also they will make it spicy if you request. We enjoyed Aalu Parotha, Chana Masala, Dal fry, Chicken Tikka and Veg thali.

Name: Nest
Reviews:
Awesome hole in the wall serving up HEARTY portions of healthy tasty food!

Vegetarian and vegan options. Also pescatarian friendly

Run by the friendliest team that have lived in LA, London and Paris

Was unsure if would leave full and left STUFFED

Good value for money too!

Stumbled across this place with a friend and we really found a gem. Whilst the decor is a little cold, the simple and cheap vietnamese food makes up for it. I had a delicious bowl of noodles and pork whilst my friend had the burger with tofu. I loved the flavour combinations but the pork was a bit too much for me a little fatty and the flavours were too strong. However the rest of the dish was delicious and my friend really enjoyed her burger.

There are plenty of veggie options as well as gluten and dairy free which I love. They even have vegan and gluten free cakes which is such a treat (although we didn't have any).

I would recommend for an interesting experience and good and inexpensive food!

We were recommended to try Nest by their neighbors at Telescope Coffee when we asked about nearby veggie-friendly options. Nest saved our day, serving up their burger (subbed avocado), salad and spring rolls. The juice menu was also very appetizing, and we plan to stop by again soon to try more.
Loved the spring rolls, banh mi, and tapioca dessert. Delicious food. Small, cute restaurant. Definitely worth it. I'll be back.

The bahn mi burger was incredible! Every bite was so delicious! And the salad to accompany it was great also. The shrimp salad was very good and the spring rolls were ok. Both desserts were good but the banana one was the best!
would 100% recommend! amazing service & the food was perfect, very flavourful and good portions.

Nest is a very cute place with Vietnamese food. It is a small restaurant where you can eat spring rolls, burgers and salad, all Vietnamese inspired. There are also delicious fresh juices like the watermelon mint juice that I had.

In this neighborhood in the middle of town are many Asian restaurant and sushi bars and such, but Nest is really something else. It is a light and airy place, with cute and colorful details, a lovely staff who speaks perfect English and is in for a chat.

I look forward to visiting this place again.

Love this place!! Food is very flavorful and healthy, and the lady is super sweet!

FYI: no seat for eating-in, seems to be only take-away / sandwiches ~ 8-9‚Ç¨ / bowls ~ 10-13‚Ç¨.
(Picture is lemongrass chicken bowl/poulet citronnelle)
big recommendation! we shared the crunchy peanut salad and the banh-mi with tofu, which both was delicious :) also the people were super friendly
Very good food and great service!

Name: Plan D - DWICH & GLACE
Reviews: Super tasty sandwiches and very friendly service! Perfect to sit by the canal with ‚ù§Ô∏è

Solid 10/10- this sandwich took me by surprise as we just grabbed it on-the-go but it was amazing!! Came back again the next day. Very small place but perfect location close to the canal to sit and eat along the water.

Yeah, it‚Äôs a stone cold 5 stars. Incredible food, location is great, you can easily sit beside the canal and eat (since it‚Äôs really a tiny bar set up inside), prices super reasonable, staff were friendly and have superhuman memory for who ordered what. One note: it‚Äôs popular and busy, so plan to queue and wait for food. Totally worth it tho.

BEST PLACE ON EARTH.
I am not kidding, I think I go there at lease once a month. They make the tastiest, most flavorful sandwiches you‚Äôll ever have. And everything is vegan. They are politically, ethically, socially engaged. The staff is the nicest.
Sandwich choices are a rotation of 2 seasonal recipes.

I had the sandwich recently. It was very good. I wish the salad was not 3‚Ç¨ more than the sandwich. Their sweet potato side dish is amazing and ample. Great place. I‚Äôm always disappointed when I walk past in late afternoon and they are closed. I‚Äôd like to take food home for dinner. Super good food.

Name: Hilo Bowls (Paris Saint-Lazare)
Reviews: First meal in Paris, salmon is good. Healthy and full of fibers. Introduction of poke bowl to sister and brother-in-law. Sister's sesame chicken katsu too salty for her as she didn't mix the contents up. Adding vegetables would have balanced up the taste.
The chicken sesame bowl was amazing, only four ingredients, but all flavors came together so well. complementing with Karen Ichiban beer was a good choice. Carrot cake with coffee was great too.

Visited Hilo and left completely wowed by the experience. The customization of the bowls was top-notch‚Äîno matter how strange my selections were (and trust me they were strange) the end result was a delicious masterpiece. Freshness and flavor are at the heart of their offerings. Highly recommend for a personalized, health-conscious meal in Paris!

To be honest one of the worst meals I‚Äôve had in Paris. I ordered tuna poke with quinoa and it was so bad I threw half of it, which I think never happened to me. Cold rock cereal, tuna wasn‚Äôt fresh, no seasoning at all, I think they either forgot to put sauce either it‚Äôs ¬´¬†normal¬†¬ª there‚Äôs not a single salty flavor. Sorry, it was really really bad.
Friendly place with nice terrace if weather permits. I had the falafel hummus wasabi poke, a solid vegan dish. Ask for some extra sauce, whichever you prefer as it was a bit dry at first.

Amazing food!
